snippet: The fatal attack on a hotel in Mali’s capital leads to questions about how a democratic society can protect itself from a few determined extremists.
abstract: Terrorist attack at Radisson Blu Hotel in Mali deals blow to nation's attempts to regain footing after military coup, terrorist takeover and fragile peace agreement; attack, carried out with apparent ease, has shaken nation's faith in its ability to rid itself of extremists.

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY, ADAM NOSSITER, CARLOTTA GALL and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey and Carlotta Gall reported from Bamako, Adam Nossiter from Paris, and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: The fatal attack on a hotel in Mali’s capital leads to questions about how a democratic society can protect itself from a few determined extremists.

headline.main: Hotel Attack in Mali Reverses Gains in Fight Against Extremism
headline.print_headline: Assault in Mali Reverses Gains on Extremism
